Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey-red pottery jar, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is lightly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394163) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394163)
